series/observations.description: Get the observations or data values for an economic data series.

realtime_start.description: The start of the real-time period.

realtime_end.description: The end of the real-time period.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return
limit.restrictions: Must be an integer between 1 and 100000

sort_order.description: Sort results is ascending or descending order for attribute values specified by order_by.

observation_start.description: The start of the observation period.

observation_end.description: The end of the observation period.

units.description: A key that indicates a data value transformation.

frequency.description: An optional parameter that indicates a lower frequency to aggregate values to. The FRED frequency aggregation feature converts higher frequency data series into lower frequency data series (e.g. converts a monthly data series into an annual data series). In FRED, the highest frequency data is daily, and the lowest frequency data is annual. There are 3 aggregation methods available- average, sum, and end of period. See https://research.stlouisfed.org/docs/api/fred/series_observations.html for more information

aggregation_method.description: A key that indicates the aggregation method used for frequency aggregation. This parameter has no affect if the frequency parameter is not set.

output_type.description: An integer that indicates an output type. See https://research.stlouisfed.org/docs/api/fred/series_observations.html#output_type for more information

vintage_dates.description: A comma separated string of YYYY-MM-DD formatted dates in history (e.g. 2000-01-01,2005-02-24). Vintage dates are used to download data as it existed on these specified dates in history. Vintage dates can be specified instead of a real-time period using realtime_start and realtime_end.
